One the same page where you set to 'No email', there is another section 
'Email Address'.  I think you need to make sure that your old email 
address (which is where you are getting the junit emails) is in the 
list.  If not, then you need to click on 'You can add an email address' 
link to add it so that Yahoo can associate your Yahoo ID with your old 
email address.

Hope this helps.
Shane

Holliday, Donald B. (LNG-SHEP) wrote:

>OK.  I give up.
>
>I can't unsubscribe because my company changed my e-mail address.
>
>A couple of days ago, per a suggestion of another member, I went to
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/, clicked the Edit My Membership link
>and changed my Message Delivery option to "No email".  I confirmed today
>that it is still set to "No email".
>
>I am still getting e-mail from this list.
>
>Does anyone know an iron clad, guaranteed method to stop receiving mail from
>this list (other than posting a patently obnoxious, xenophobic message that
>gets me kicked off)?
>
>Thanks,
>
>Donald Holliday
>
